place.name: PERIVALE
place.gazetteerText: PERRIVALE, or Greenford-Parva, a parish in Brentford district, Middlesex; on the river Brent, 1¾mile N W by N of Ealing r. station. Post-town, Ealing, under London W. Acres, 626. Real property, £1, 400. Pop., 43. Houses, 8. The living is a rectory in the diocese of London. Value, £315. Patron, Madame Delpiere. The church is plain, and has a woodentower. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
